name: Michael Hawthorne

topics.response_text: Don't suppose you'll let me finish this drink before killing me? Hmm?{there is a full scale massacre going on, and he is drinking pretending it isn't happening.}

topics.topic_text: I don't suppose you know anything about the basement? And some tunnels?
topics.response_text: Tunnels in the basement? No can't say that I do.{high class alcoholic struggling to remember something}

topics.topic_text: What's it like living at Tenpenny Tower?
topics.response_text: It's clean and safe  since those Ghouls left  and Tenpenny knows how to stock the lounge with the good stuff. Stop by. Share a drink!{high class alcoholic}

topics.topic_text: I'm nobody in particular. But I'm sure you'll soon come to like me.
topics.response_text: Oh, fine. We'll have to share a drink sometime. I'm always in the Federalist Lounge. There's certainly plenty to drink about.{snobby self important alcoholic}
Well, then you'll excuse me if I don't invite you to share a drink?{snobby self important alcoholic brushing off a put down}
I'm glad to meet someone who doesn't want to talk my ear off. We should get a drink together. I hate when people talk while I'm drinking. Don't you?{snobby self important alcoholic}

topics.topic_text: You could say I'm an expert when it comes to dealing with Ghouls.
topics.response_text: Really? Fantastic! You can give that Gustavo a lesson or two!{happy to have a hero and frustrated at person who isn't fixing the problem}

topics.topic_text: Let's just say I never met a Ghoul I liked.
topics.response_text: They do seem a bit anti-social don't they?{high class alcoholic concurring with a drinking buddy}

topics.topic_text: Look, I know enough about Ghouls not to hate them.
topics.response_text: Oh. I see. Well. I've never met one, so I wouldn't know. I just always thought... I guess I really don't know what I thought...{high class alcoholic coming to terms with his bigotry, and losing his train of thought}

topics.topic_text: What's it like living at Tenpenny Tower?
topics.response_text: Well it's a great place to live... IF you don't mind GHOULS breathing down your neck.{(emphasize IF and GHOULS) high class alcoholic muttering under his breath}

topics.topic_text: I don't suppose you know much about those Ghouls?
topics.response_text: We haven't discussed this already? Apparently there's a pack of zombies living in the tunnels. Gustavo says he has it under control.{high class alcoholic}

topics.topic_text: I might be able to help deal with the problem.
topics.response_text: Yeah? Talk to Gustavo. He may wish to employ your assistance.{surprised but happy someone is taking charge}

topics.topic_text: You ever wonder if maybe you drink too much?
topics.response_text: Look around... what else is there to do?{self important indignation}
We shall simply have to ignore them until they bugger off.{(resigned) self important snob}

topics.topic_text: How would you feel about having a few Ghoul neighbors?
topics.response_text: I know you've been talking to the others about the Ghouls... and I've been mulling the whole thing over a few cocktails... well more than a few...{hesitant but sincere}

topics.topic_text: It's wise to be afraid of Ghouls. They'll kill you when you aren't looking.
topics.response_text: So I've heard. I have to wonder though, if they are all mindless killing machines, why do some of them want to be treated like humans so badly?{snob losing prejudice}

topics.topic_text: I've met these Ghouls. They're civilized and pose no threat.
topics.response_text: Really? Well... As long as they don't bother me... I guess,  I really don't care.{letting go of prejudice}

topics.topic_text: Would you tell Mister Tenpenny that you wouldn't mind Ghoul neighbors?

topics.response_text: You're the one that asked the question. If you don't mind, I'd like to get another drink.{high class alcoholic}

conversation.response_text: Oh that? It was nothing. A one time indiscretion, I assure you. Won't happen again, ol' chap. Scouts honor and all that. Care for a drink?{a high class drunk dismissing mention of a disturbance he cause either}

What? Oh right. Hah! That's a good one, Daring. I'm fine really. I've been drinking since I was a toddler. I can hold my liquor. What's new with you?{confused, then gets the joke. "Daring" is the nickname of his friend}
Indeed! I'll drink to that! Cheers!{making a toast}
My stomach is growling at me.{hungry and on his way to get food}
Well. I better go pass out for a while.{tired and heading off to bed}
I'm umm... I'm going to go stretch my legs for awhile. Take a little walk around the tower to loosen up my nerves a little.{covering for his sneaking out to be with his mistress}
Daring! What the bloody hell are you up to this time?{confused and slightly suspicious}

description:
Michael Hawthorne is a 52 year-old Caucasian Male.

A middle-aged resident of Tenpenny Tower who has become the Federalist Lounge's most dedicated patron. Michael's life has been consumed by alcoholism, leaving him nearly broke but maintaining a cynical wit that occasionally surfaces between drinks. Despite his constant drunken stupor, he maintains a friendly rivalry with Dashwood and occasional romantic rendezvous with the tower's courtesan, Susan Lancaster.

Michael Hawthorne's Personality: Cynical and self-deprecating with a hidden sense of humor. Michael appears apathetic about life but forms connections with others through shared drinks and jabs. He harbors an irrational prejudice against ghouls despite never having actually met one.

Michael Hawthorne's Backstory: Before the war, Michael Hawthorne lived a relatively ordinary life in the D.C. area. When the bombs fell in 2077, he managed to survive and eventually found his way to Tenpenny Tower, where he used his remaining savings to establish himself as a resident. Over the years, what little wealth he had left was gradually consumed by his growing dependence on alcohol. His drinking habit has become so ingrained that he's rarely seen without a drink in hand, making him both a fixture of the Federalist Lounge and a cautionary tale among the tower's more sober residents.
